Thank you, Doctor, for being a source of hope and healing.

I recently had my gallbladder removed at Apollo Hospital, and I couldn’t be more grateful for the excellent care I received. For over a year, I suffered from severe gallbladder attacks and kept trying to manage the pain, but it kept getting worse. I was very nervous about surgery since it was my first one, but I finally made the decision to go ahead, and it’s truly changed my life for the better. Choosing a doctor can be overwhelming with so many options, but I was referred to Dr. Raghunath K. J., who came highly recommended. He performed my cholecystectomy surgery with great skill and care. Although there were some complications that made the procedure longer than usual, Dr. Raghunath handled everything calmly and professionally, detecting and resolving the underlying issues. I stayed in the hospital for two nights and was extremely well taken care of by the whole team — Dr. Raghunath K. J., Dr. Ashwin, Dr. Jane, Farhath, Meena, and Kavita. Their attention, compassion, and professionalism made the whole experience so much easier. Now that I’m back home in Tanzania, eating well and feeling healthy. Thank you to Apollo Hospital and to the amazing team for helping me get through this with such great results. I truly appreciate everything you’ve done! — Khadija (Tanzanian Patient)

We are truly grateful to Apollo Chennai, and especially everyone in the L Ward Extension, where my father was admitted for 13 days due to his complicated condition, for their amazing care and support during my father's treatment. The hospital was very well-managed, even small issues, whenever reported, were taken care of immediately and efficiently. The environment was clean, organized, and the staff always made sure patients and families were comfortable. Every nurse, staff member, and caretaker there was extremely helpful, calm, and kind. Our heartfelt gratitude to Dr. Babu Manohar Sir and Dr. M. Saravanan Sir, whose expertise and compassion made this difficult journey much easier for our family. The coordination between the doctors, nurses, and support staff was truly impressive, and we always felt that my father was in the safest hands. We will always remember the kindness and care shown to our family during this time.

I recently had the experience of visiting Greams Lane Apollo Hospital in Chennai, and while there are some positive aspects, I was ultimately disappointed with the overall service provided. Positive Aspects: The hospital is well-maintained and clean, which creates a reassuring environment for patients. Additionally, the valet parking service was a thoughtful touch, offering convenience for visitors. Areas for Improvement: However, my experience with the internal coordination was less than satisfactory. While the coordination outside the hospital (such as valet parking) was efficient, the process within the hospital was poorly managed. Patients or their families are required to independently navigate between departments for various tasks, without clear guidance or support. This lack of internal coordination created unnecessary confusion and delays, making the overall experience stressful. Cost Transparency & Pricing: One of the most concerning aspects of my visit was the pricing structure. My daughter underwent a relatively simple procedure to remove a cyst in the Day Care facility, which ended up costing over Rs. 1,00,000. This price was never disclosed to me beforehand, despite my repeated attempts to clarify the costs. The final amount was a shock, and I found it to be exorbitant considering the nature of the procedure. This procedure could have been performed at other reputable hospital for maximum 25% - 35% of this cost. Comparison to Other Locations: I have previously visited the Kolkata Apollo Hospital, which, in my experience, offers a much better level of internal coordination, transparency in pricing, and overall cost-effectiveness. I am confused about the rationale as lots of Bengali people come to Apollo Chennai for treatment. Conclusion: While Greams Lane Apollo may be well-maintained, the lack of coordination between departments, coupled with the shockingly high and opaque pricing, has left me with serious reservations about recommending this hospital for routine procedures. I would advise potential patients to inquire thoroughly about costs and seek clarification about internal processes before committing to treatment.

The Pharmacy team managed our complex medication schedule promptly, and the Physiotherapy & Rehabilitation experts provided useful post-surgical advice for general mobility and recovery. ​Specialty Centers (The Assurance): It is deeply reassuring to be in a hospital where the Centres of Excellence, such as the Apollo Heart Institute, Neurosciences, Orthopedics, and Oncology, stand ready. This breadth of capability offers an unparalleled layer of security. ​Management & Administration (The Engine): The Front Office and Billing/Insurance departments handled complex paperwork with speed and grace, allowing us to focus entirely on recovery. Their professionalism is the smooth oil that keeps this massive operation running. ​The Sanctuary: Platinum Wing (Apollo Sindoori Hotel Limited) ​Our stay in the Platinum Wing, managed by Apollo Sindoori, was truly a luxury staycation integrated with healing. This was not a hospital room; it was a sanctuary. ​The Housekeeping and Facility Management staff were discreet and impeccable, maintaining pristine conditions. The true highlight was the personalized hospitality and Catering Services. The food, tailored to my father's post-operative diet and our own preferences, was gourmet-level, freshly prepared, and served with warmth. The Sindoori team transformed a medical requirement into a genuinely restorative experience, ensuring comfort, peace, and five-star service throughout our recovery period. ​In conclusion, our profound gratitude extends from the skill of Dr. Balaji to the warmth of the nursing staff, the rigor of the clinical teams, and the comforting luxury of the Platinum Wing. Apollo Main Hospitals, supported by Apollo Sindoori, is truly setting a global standard where patient care and sophisticated hospitality converge. We wholeheartedly recommend this institution. ​Kaushik Saha Son of Kamal Kumar Saha
We stayed Apollo Chennai at room 3305. House keeping service was adequately good. Particularly Ms. Asma and Mr. Kishore were outstanding with their prompt responses and good care.

The paramedics were great and immediately knew that I had a heart attack and informed the main hospital asap. The ICU cardiac unit team of doctors and support staff were ready and administered what was needed to save me..in the end I had a laser angioplasty which cleared the 100% clot and I got a new lease of life. I owe my life to that team and their service with a smile is still etched deep in my memory. Kudos to them and I salute them.

Room no 3326 Housekeeping service was very good,specially Gopal went out of his way to help. We had a warmth welcome n everyone was very nice I would like to thank Dr Mohammad Rehan n his entire team for their professionalism n all the ICU staff n the private ward staffI would like to express my heartfelt gratitude to Dr. Mohamad Rehan Sayeed for successfully performing my CABG surgery and for the outstanding care I received throughout this journey. His expertise, confidence, and compassionate approach gave me and my family immense reassurance during a very critical time. My sincere thanks also go to the entire team — the emergency staff for their swift action, the nursing team for their tireless care, and the cleaning staff for maintaining a safe and hygienic environment. Each of them played an essential role in my recovery. A special mention goes to Dr. Kavya, whose clear explanations and constant guidance made the medical process easier to understand and less stressful. I am also grateful to Nalini, Dr. Sayeed’s assistant, whose coordination and kindness helped everything run smoothly. In the ICU, Nurse Afiya’s attentiveness, patience, and genuine care during the most critical hours of my recovery made a lasting difference. I also wish to recall that when I landed in Chennai on 02.09.25, I came across a billboard that read: “Chennai is the City of Health.” This statement truly reflects what many around the world believe — that in healthcare, Chennai stands as a world leader. With doctors like Dr. Sayeed and his highly competent team, the city has every reason to be proud of this honour. May God bless doctors like Dr. Sayeed so that, one day, people everywhere may be free from the suffering caused by ill health.

Heartfelt Review & Recommendation for Dr. Kartik Natarajan, Gastroenterologist at Apollo One. I wish to express my sincere gratitude and admiration for Dr. Kartik Natarajan, Gastroenterologist at Apollo One, Greams Road. He is truly a star doctor of the Apollo Hospitals' Gastroenterology Department. Dr. Kartik's vast experience, accurate diagnosis, and outstanding treatment approach reflect the true essence of Apollo Hospitals’ excellence. What sets him apart is not only his medical expertise but also his kindness, patience, and friendly behavior. He listens with genuine concern, makes patients feel at ease, and explains everything with remarkable clarity and compassion. I wholeheartedly recommend Dr. Kartik Natarajan to anyone in need of expert gastroenterological care. His dedication and humane approach truly uphold the values and reputation of Apollo Hospitals. Thank you, Doctor, for being a source of hope and healing.

I recently had my gallbladder removed at Apollo Hospital, and I couldn’t be more grateful for the excellent care I received. For over a year, I suffered from severe gallbladder attacks and kept trying to manage the pain, but it kept getting worse. I was very nervous about surgery since it was my first one, but I finally made the decision to go ahead, and it’s truly changed my life for the better. Choosing a doctor can be overwhelming with so many options, but I was referred to Dr. Raghunath K. J., who came highly recommended. He performed my cholecystectomy surgery with great skill and care. Although there were some complications that made the procedure longer than usual, Dr. Raghunath handled everything calmly and professionally, detecting and resolving the underlying issues. I stayed in the hospital for two nights and was extremely well taken care of by the whole team — Dr. Raghunath K. J., Dr. Ashwin, Dr. Jane, Farhath, Meena, and Kavita. Their attention, compassion, and professionalism made the whole experience so much easier. Now that I’m back home in Tanzania, eating well and feeling healthy. Thank you to Apollo Hospital and to the amazing team for helping me get through this with such great results. I truly appreciate everything you’ve done! — Khadija (Tanzanian Patient)

We are truly grateful to Apollo Chennai, and especially everyone in the L Ward Extension, where my father was admitted for 13 days due to his complicated condition, for their amazing care and support during my father's treatment. The hospital was very well-managed, even small issues, whenever reported, were taken care of immediately and efficiently. The environment was clean, organized, and the staff always made sure patients and families were comfortable. Every nurse, staff member, and caretaker there was extremely helpful, calm, and kind. Our heartfelt gratitude to Dr. Babu Manohar Sir and Dr. M. Saravanan Sir, whose expertise and compassion made this difficult journey much easier for our family. The coordination between the doctors, nurses, and support staff was truly impressive, and we always felt that my father was in the safest hands. We will always remember the kindness and care shown to our family during this time.

I recently had the experience of visiting Greams Lane Apollo Hospital in Chennai, and while there are some positive aspects, I was ultimately disappointed with the overall service provided. Positive Aspects: The hospital is well-maintained and clean, which creates a reassuring environment for patients. Additionally, the valet parking service was a thoughtful touch, offering convenience for visitors. Areas for Improvement: However, my experience with the internal coordination was less than satisfactory. While the coordination outside the hospital (such as valet parking) was efficient, the process within the hospital was poorly managed. Patients or their families are required to independently navigate between departments for various tasks, without clear guidance or support. This lack of internal coordination created unnecessary confusion and delays, making the overall experience stressful. Cost Transparency & Pricing: One of the most concerning aspects of my visit was the pricing structure. My daughter underwent a relatively simple procedure to remove a cyst in the Day Care facility, which ended up costing over Rs. 1,00,000. This price was never disclosed to me beforehand, despite my repeated attempts to clarify the costs. The final amount was a shock, and I found it to be exorbitant considering the nature of the procedure. This procedure could have been performed at other reputable hospital for maximum 25% - 35% of this cost. Comparison to Other Locations: I have previously visited the Kolkata Apollo Hospital, which, in my experience, offers a much better level of internal coordination, transparency in pricing, and overall cost-effectiveness. I am confused about the rationale as lots of Bengali people come to Apollo Chennai for treatment. Conclusion: While Greams Lane Apollo may be well-maintained, the lack of coordination between departments, coupled with the shockingly high and opaque pricing, has left me with serious reservations about recommending this hospital for routine procedures. I would advise potential patients to inquire thoroughly about costs and seek clarification about internal processes before committing to treatment.

His expertise, confidence, and compassionate approach gave me and my family immense reassurance during a very critical time. My sincere thanks also go to the entire team — the emergency staff for their swift action, the nursing team for their tireless care, and the cleaning staff for maintaining a safe and hygienic environment. Each of them played an essential role in my recovery. A special mention goes to Dr. Kavya, whose clear explanations and constant guidance made the medical process easier to understand and less stressful. I am also grateful to Nalini, Dr. Sayeed’s assistant, whose coordination and kindness helped everything run smoothly. In the ICU, Nurse Afiya’s attentiveness, patience, and genuine care during the most critical hours of my recovery made a lasting difference. I also wish to recall that when I landed in Chennai on 02.09.25, I came across a billboard that read: “Chennai is the City of Health.” This statement truly reflects what many around the world believe — that in healthcare, Chennai stands as a world leader. With doctors like Dr. Sayeed and his highly competent team, the city has every reason to be proud of this honour. May God bless doctors like Dr. Sayeed so that, one day, people everywhere may be free from the suffering caused by ill health.

Heartfelt Review & Recommendation for Dr. Kartik Natarajan, Gastroenterologist at Apollo One. I wish to express my sincere gratitude and admiration for Dr. Kartik Natarajan, Gastroenterologist at Apollo One, Greams Road. He is truly a star doctor of the Apollo Hospitals' Gastroenterology Department. Dr. Kartik's vast experience, accurate diagnosis, and outstanding treatment approach reflect the true essence of Apollo Hospitals’ excellence. What sets him apart is not only his medical expertise but also his kindness, patience, and friendly behavior. He listens with genuine concern, makes patients feel at ease, and explains everything with remarkable clarity and compassion. I wholeheartedly recommend Dr. Kartik Natarajan to anyone in need of expert gastroenterological care. His dedication and humane approach truly uphold the values and reputation of Apollo Hospitals. Thank you, Doctor, for being a source of hope and healing.

I recently had my gallbladder removed at Apollo Hospital, and I couldn’t be more grateful for the excellent care I received. For over a year, I suffered from severe gallbladder attacks and kept trying to manage the pain, but it kept getting worse. I was very nervous about surgery since it was my first one, but I finally made the decision to go ahead, and it’s truly changed my life for the better. Choosing a doctor can be overwhelming with so many options, but I was referred to Dr. Raghunath K. J., who came highly recommended. He performed my cholecystectomy surgery with great skill and care. Although there were some complications that made the procedure longer than usual, Dr. Raghunath handled everything calmly and professionally, detecting and resolving the underlying issues. I stayed in the hospital for two nights and was extremely well taken care of by the whole team — Dr. Raghunath K. J., Dr. Ashwin, Dr. Jane, Farhath, Meena, and Kavita. Their attention, compassion, and professionalism made the whole experience so much easier. Now that I’m back home in Tanzania, eating well and feeling healthy. Thank you to Apollo Hospital and to the amazing team for helping me get through this with such great results. I truly appreciate everything you’ve done! — Khadija (Tanzanian Patient)

We are truly grateful to Apollo Chennai, and especially everyone in the L Ward Extension, where my father was admitted for 13 days due to his complicated condition, for their amazing care and support during my father's treatment. The hospital was very well-managed, even small issues, whenever reported, were taken care of immediately and efficiently. The environment was clean, organized, and the staff always made sure patients and families were comfortable. Every nurse, staff member, and caretaker there was extremely helpful, calm, and kind. Our heartfelt gratitude to Dr. Babu Manohar Sir and Dr. M. Saravanan Sir, whose expertise and compassion made this difficult journey much easier for our family. The coordination between the doctors, nurses, and support staff was truly impressive, and we always felt that my father was in the safest hands. We will always remember the kindness and care shown to our family during this time.

I recently had the experience of visiting Greams Lane Apollo Hospital in Chennai, and while there are some positive aspects, I was ultimately disappointed with the overall service provided. Positive Aspects: The hospital is well-maintained and clean, which creates a reassuring environment for patients. Additionally, the valet parking service was a thoughtful touch, offering convenience for visitors. Areas for Improvement: However, my experience with the internal coordination was less than satisfactory. While the coordination outside the hospital (such as valet parking) was efficient, the process within the hospital was poorly managed. Patients or their families are required to independently navigate between departments for various tasks, without clear guidance or support. This lack of internal coordination created unnecessary confusion and delays, making the overall experience stressful. Cost Transparency & Pricing: One of the most concerning aspects of my visit was the pricing structure. My daughter underwent a relatively simple procedure to remove a cyst in the Day Care facility, which ended up costing over Rs. 1,00,000. This price was never disclosed to me beforehand, despite my repeated attempts to clarify the costs. The final amount was a shock, and I found it to be exorbitant considering the nature of the procedure. This procedure could have been performed at other reputable hospital for maximum 25% - 35% of this cost. Comparison to Other Locations: I have previously visited the Kolkata Apollo Hospital, which, in my experience, offers a much better level of internal coordination, transparency in pricing, and overall cost-effectiveness. I am confused about the rationale as lots of Bengali people come to Apollo Chennai for treatment. Conclusion: While Greams Lane Apollo may be well-maintained, the lack of coordination between departments, coupled with the shockingly high and opaque pricing, has left me with serious reservations about recommending this hospital for routine procedures. I would advise potential patients to inquire thoroughly about costs and seek clarification about internal processes before committing to treatment.

The Epitome of Healing and Hospitality: A Review of Apollo Main Hospitals & Platinum Wing ​Patient: Kamal Kumar Saha | Procedure: Successful Septoplasty Review by: Kaushik Saha, Son Date: October 23, 2025 ​Our journey at Apollo Main Hospitals, Chennai, was nothing short of transformational—a blend of medical excellence and a world-class 'staycation' that redefined our perception of healthcare. The successful septoplasty performed on my father, Mr. Kamal Kumar Saha, was the centerpiece of an experience orchestrated with brilliance and compassion at every turn. ​The Maestro: Dr. R. Balaji (ENT Surgeon) ​The surgical outcome is a testament to the masterful skill of Dr. R. Balaji. From the initial consultation, Dr. Balaji’s calm assurance and crystal-clear explanation of the septoplasty procedure eliminated all anxiety. His extensive experience in Otorhinolaryngology was evident in the flawless execution of the surgery. Post-operatively, my father's breathing improved dramatically and immediately. Dr. Balaji is not just a surgeon; he is a specialist whose proficiency elevates the entire institution. ​A City of Care: The Apollo Main Hospitals Ecosystem ​The hospital itself is a meticulously managed ecosystem, operating with the precision of a high-tech city. Every department contributed to our seamless experience: ​Clinical Excellence (The Frontline): The Pre-Anesthesia team prepared my father with diligence, and the post-operative monitoring by the Critical Care unit was vigilant and reassuring. The Emergency Medicine department, though thankfully not needed, provided comfort simply by knowing it operated 24/7 with readiness. ​Diagnostic & Support Services (The Backbone): The efficiency of the Radiology and Pathology/Diagnostics labs ensured swift and accurate pre-op clearances. The Pharmacy team managed our complex medication schedule promptly, and the Physiotherapy & Rehabilitation experts provided useful post-surgical advice for general mobility and recovery. ​Specialty Centers (The Assurance): It is deeply reassuring to be in a hospital where the Centres of Excellence, such as the Apollo Heart Institute, Neurosciences, Orthopedics, and Oncology, stand ready. This breadth of capability offers an unparalleled layer of security. ​Management & Administration (The Engine): The Front Office and Billing/Insurance departments handled complex paperwork with speed and grace, allowing us to focus entirely on recovery. Their professionalism is the smooth oil that keeps this massive operation running. ​The Sanctuary: Platinum Wing (Apollo Sindoori Hotel Limited) ​Our stay in the Platinum Wing, managed by Apollo Sindoori, was truly a luxury staycation integrated with healing. This was not a hospital room; it was a sanctuary. ​The Housekeeping and Facility Management staff were discreet and impeccable, maintaining pristine conditions. The true highlight was the personalized hospitality and Catering Services. The food, tailored to my father's post-operative diet and our own preferences, was gourmet-level, freshly prepared, and served with warmth. The Sindoori team transformed a medical requirement into a genuinely restorative experience, ensuring comfort, peace, and five-star service throughout our recovery period. ​In conclusion, our profound gratitude extends from the skill of Dr. Balaji to the warmth of the nursing staff, the rigor of the clinical teams, and the comforting luxury of the Platinum Wing. Apollo Main Hospitals, supported by Apollo Sindoori, is truly setting a global standard where patient care and sophisticated hospitality converge. We wholeheartedly recommend this institution. ​Kaushik Saha Son of Kamal Kumar Saha
We stayed Apollo Chennai at room 3305. House keeping service was adequately good. Particularly Ms. Asma and Mr. Kishore were outstanding with their prompt responses and good care.

The paramedics were great and immediately knew that I had a heart attack and informed the main hospital asap. The ICU cardiac unit team of doctors and support staff were ready and administered what was needed to save me..in the end I had a laser angioplasty which cleared the 100% clot and I got a new lease of life. I owe my life to that team and their service with a smile is still etched deep in my memory. Kudos to them and I salute them.

Starbucks (Church Street) Spacious outlet with the signature Starbucks calm — good crowd energy. Ideal for long work sessions or relaxed coffee meets. Seating mix of sofas, bar chairs, and outdoor spots. Staff are friendly, remember your regular order if you visit often. Consistent coffee quality, quick Wi-Fi, clean washroom. Peak hours (evenings/weekends) get busy — grab seats early. Nice people-watching spot facing Church Street’s hustle.

The best Starbucks I have ever gone to. I kept ma bag of apparel there and forgot it. I live in Whitefields. so I asked one of Nike’s employee to get there and collect my bag and the Starbucks employee wanted to see me in FaceTime and only when I agreed to giving the bag to the Nike employee. He gave it. This shows how experienced he is and also doesn’t want my bag to go into bad hands. I am so grateful to him. I have posted a picture of him aswell. Thanks Starbucks

Starbucks offers consistently great coffee with a wide range of drinks and snacks. The ambiance is cozy, perfect for working or meeting friends. Service is generally fast and friendly, though it can get busy during peak hours. A reliable spot for coffee lovers!

Visited this store today at around 8:15am, confirmed with the staff if the outlet is open or closed, after confirming that the store is operational at the given time, waited for about 10 min and the barista forget taking order did not even greet or ask to wait. She continued to do her work as if the customer standing in front did not exist at all. Such a lackadaisical attitude is not expected at Starbucks especially when the customer is a very regular customer at various other outlets and knows the quality of service provided. Informed the store manager over call about the same.

I visited the place with my friend. We had and beverage abd food everything was delicious, but the washroom wasn't clean; it smelled ther is no tissues its awful. When I went to ask the employee wearing a blue T shirt, he told me they didn't have any tissues. What a blunt way to put it! He was so rude; he doesn't know how to treat customers.
The staff is slow. They made mistakes twice in preparing the order. The worst branch I have visited in my life.

Starbucks on Church Street, Bengaluru, is an exceptional spot that effortlessly combines the charm of a vibrant café with the serene ambiance of a perfect retreat. Located in the heart of one of the city’s most iconic streets, this outlet exudes warmth and sophistication, making it a favorite destination for coffee lovers and social gatherings alike. The moment you step in, you’re greeted by the rich aroma of freshly brewed coffee, instantly uplifting your spirits. The décor is a blend of contemporary elegance and cozy vibes, with two floors of comfortable seating that caters to couples, solo visitors, friends catching up, or even those working remotely. The subtle lighting and soothing music add a touch of tranquility, making it an ideal escape from the bustling city outside. The menu, as always, features Starbucks’ signature range of coffees, teas, and seasonal specials. Their handcrafted beverages are consistently delightful, with my personal favorite being the Java chip frupichino, paired perfectly with a warm croissant. The staff is courteous, attentive, and ensures a seamless experience, even during busy hours. One of the standout aspects of this outlet is its first floor seating area, it offers a refreshing space to enjoy your coffee while soaking in the vibrant energy of Church Street. Overall, Starbucks Church Street is not just a café but a destination in itself. Whether you're here for a quick caffeine fix, a relaxed evening, or to catch up on work, this Starbucks delivers on all fronts. Highly recommended!

Excellent place for meetings. Situated at the start of church street and Brigade road. Sitting space at ground and first floor. Availed the 25% off for the first 3 orders.No parking options. You can use the normal church street parking and walk. Metro is also nearby.

Starbucks on Church Street, Bengaluru, is an exceptional spot that effortlessly combines the charm of a vibrant café with the serene ambiance of a perfect retreat. Located in the heart of one of the city’s most iconic streets, this outlet exudes warmth and sophistication, making it a favorite destination for coffee lovers and social gatherings alike. The moment you step in, you’re greeted by the rich aroma of freshly brewed coffee, instantly uplifting your spirits. The décor is a blend of contemporary elegance and cozy vibes, with two floors of comfortable seating that caters to couples, solo visitors, friends catching up, or even those working remotely. The subtle lighting and soothing music add a touch of tranquility, making it an ideal escape from the bustling city outside. The menu, as always, features Starbucks’ signature range of coffees, teas, and seasonal specials. The staff is courteous, attentive, and ensures a seamless experience, even during busy hours. One of the standout aspects of this outlet is its first floor seating area, it offers a refreshing space to enjoy your coffee while soaking in the vibrant energy of Church Street. Overall, Starbucks Church Street is not just a café but a destination in itself. Whether you're here for a quick caffeine fix, a relaxed evening, or to catch up on work, this Starbucks delivers on all fronts. Highly recommended!

Starbucks offers consistently great coffee with a wide range of drinks and snacks. The ambiance is cozy, perfect for working or meeting friends. Service is generally fast and friendly, though it can get busy during peak hours. A reliable spot for coffee lovers!

Visited this store today at around 8:15am, confirmed with the staff if the outlet is open or closed, after confirming that the store is operational at the given time, waited for about 10 min and the barista forget taking order did not even greet or ask to wait. She continued to do her work as if the customer standing in front did not exist at all. Such a lackadaisical attitude is not expected at Starbucks especially when the customer is a very regular customer at various other outlets and knows the quality of service provided. Informed the store manager over call about the same.

I visited the place with my friend. We had and beverage abd food everything was delicious, but the washroom wasn't clean; it smelled ther is no tissues its awful. When I went to ask the employee wearing a blue T shirt, he told me they didn't have any tissues. What a blunt way to put it! He was so rude; he doesn't know how to treat customers.
The staff is slow. They made mistakes twice in preparing the order. The worst branch I have visited in my life.

Starbucks on Church Street, Bengaluru, is an exceptional spot that effortlessly combines the charm of a vibrant café with the serene ambiance of a perfect retreat. Located in the heart of one of the city’s most iconic streets, this outlet exudes warmth and sophistication, making it a favorite destination for coffee lovers and social gatherings alike. The moment you step in, you’re greeted by the rich aroma of freshly brewed coffee, instantly uplifting your spirits. The décor is a blend of contemporary elegance and cozy vibes, with two floors of comfortable seating that caters to couples, solo visitors, friends catching up, or even those working remotely. The subtle lighting and soothing music add a touch of tranquility, making it an ideal escape from the bustling city outside. The menu, as always, features Starbucks’ signature range of coffees, teas, and seasonal specials. Their handcrafted beverages are consistently delightful, with my personal favorite being the Java chip frupichino, paired perfectly with a warm croissant. The staff is courteous, attentive, and ensures a seamless experience, even during busy hours. One of the standout aspects of this outlet is its first floor seating area, it offers a refreshing space to enjoy your coffee while soaking in the vibrant energy of Church Street. Overall, Starbucks Church Street is not just a café but a destination in itself. Whether you're here for a quick caffeine fix, a relaxed evening, or to catch up on work, this Starbucks delivers on all fronts. Highly recommended!

The subtle lighting and soothing music add a touch of tranquility, making it an ideal escape from the bustling city outside. The menu, as always, features Starbucks’ signature range of coffees, teas, and seasonal specials. Their handcrafted beverages are consistently delightful, with my personal favorite being the Java chip frupichino, paired perfectly with a warm croissant. The staff is courteous, attentive, and ensures a seamless experience, even during busy hours. One of the standout aspects of this outlet is its first floor seating area, it offers a refreshing space to enjoy your coffee while soaking in the vibrant energy of Church Street. Overall, Starbucks Church Street is not just a café but a destination in itself. Whether you're here for a quick caffeine fix, a relaxed evening, or to catch up on work, this Starbucks delivers on all fronts. Highly recommended!

The best Starbucks I have ever gone to. I kept ma bag of apparel there and forgot it. Visited this store today at around 8:15am, confirmed with the staff if the outlet is open or closed, after confirming that the store is operational at the given time, waited for about 10 min and the barista forget taking order did not even greet or ask to wait. Such a lackadaisical attitude is not expected at Starbucks especially when the customer is a very regular customer at various other outlets and knows the quality of service provided. Informed the store manager over call about the same.

I visited the place with my friend. We had and beverage abd food everything was delicious, but the washroom wasn't clean; it smelled ther is no tissues its awful. When I went to ask the employee wearing a blue T shirt, he told me they didn't have any tissues. What a blunt way to put it! He was so rude; he doesn't know how to treat customers.
The staff is slow. They made mistakes twice in preparing the order. The worst branch I have visited in my life.

Starbucks on Church Street, Bengaluru, is an exceptional spot that effortlessly combines the charm of a vibrant café with the serene ambiance of a perfect retreat. Located in the heart of one of the city’s most iconic streets, this outlet exudes warmth and sophistication, making it a favorite destination for coffee lovers and social gatherings alike. The moment you step in, you’re greeted by the rich aroma of freshly brewed coffee, instantly uplifting your spirits. The décor is a blend of contemporary elegance and cozy vibes, with two floors of comfortable seating that caters to couples, solo visitors, friends catching up, or even those working remotely. The subtle lighting and soothing music add a touch of tranquility, making it an ideal escape from the bustling city outside. The menu, as always, features Starbucks’ signature range of coffees, teas, and seasonal specials. The staff is courteous, attentive, and ensures a seamless experience, even during busy hours. One of the standout aspects of this outlet is its first floor seating area, it offers a refreshing space to enjoy your coffee while soaking in the vibrant energy of Church Street. Overall, Starbucks Church Street is not just a café but a destination in itself. Whether you're here for a quick caffeine fix, a relaxed evening, or to catch up on work, this Starbucks delivers on all fronts. Highly recommended!

Starbucks offers consistently great coffee with a wide range of drinks and snacks. The ambiance is cozy, perfect for working or meeting friends. Service is generally fast and friendly, though it can get busy during peak hours. A reliable spot for coffee lovers!

Visited this store today at around 8:15am, confirmed with the staff if the outlet is open or closed, after confirming that the store is operational at the given time, waited for about 10 min and the barista forget taking order did not even greet or ask to wait. She continued to do her work as if the customer standing in front did not exist at all. Such a lackadaisical attitude is not expected at Starbucks especially when the customer is a very regular customer at various other outlets and knows the quality of service provided. Informed the store manager over call about the same.

I visited the place with my friend. We had and beverage abd food everything was delicious, but the washroom wasn't clean; it smelled ther is no tissues its awful. When I went to ask the employee wearing a blue T shirt, he told me they didn't have any tissues. What a blunt way to put it! He was so rude; he doesn't know how to treat customers.
The staff is slow. They made mistakes twice in preparing the order. The worst branch I have visited in my life.

Starbucks on Church Street, Bengaluru, is an exceptional spot that effortlessly combines the charm of a vibrant café with the serene ambiance of a perfect retreat. Located in the heart of one of the city’s most iconic streets, this outlet exudes warmth and sophistication, making it a favorite destination for coffee lovers and social gatherings alike. The moment you step in, you’re greeted by the rich aroma of freshly brewed coffee, instantly uplifting your spirits. The décor is a blend of contemporary elegance and cozy vibes, with two floors of comfortable seating that caters to couples, solo visitors, friends catching up, or even those working remotely. The subtle lighting and soothing music add a touch of tranquility, making it an ideal escape from the bustling city outside. The menu, as always, features Starbucks’ signature range of coffees, teas, and seasonal specials. Their handcrafted beverages are consistently delightful, with my personal favorite being the Java chip frupichino, paired perfectly with a warm croissant. The staff is courteous, attentive, and ensures a seamless experience, even during busy hours. One of the standout aspects of this outlet is its first floor seating area, it offers a refreshing space to enjoy your coffee while soaking in the vibrant energy of Church Street. Overall, Starbucks Church Street is not just a café but a destination in itself. Whether you're here for a quick caffeine fix, a relaxed evening, or to catch up on work, this Starbucks delivers on all fronts. Highly recommended!

The subtle lighting and soothing music add a touch of tranquility, making it an ideal escape from the bustling city outside. The menu, as always, features Starbucks’ signature range of coffees, teas, and seasonal specials. Their handcrafted beverages are consistently delightful, with my personal favorite being the Java chip frupichino, paired perfectly with a warm croissant. The staff is courteous, attentive, and ensures a seamless experience, even during busy hours. One of the standout aspects of this outlet is its first floor seating area, it offers a refreshing space to enjoy your coffee while soaking in the vibrant energy of Church Street. Overall, Starbucks Church Street is not just a café but a destination in itself. Whether you're here for a quick caffeine fix, a relaxed evening, or to catch up on work, this Starbucks delivers on all fronts. Highly recommended!

The best Starbucks I have ever gone to. I kept ma bag of apparel there and forgot it. Visited this store today at around 8:15am, confirmed with the staff if the outlet is open or closed, after confirming that the store is operational at the given time, waited for about 10 min and the barista forget taking order did not even greet or ask to wait. Such a lackadaisical attitude is not expected at Starbucks especially when the customer is a very regular customer at various other outlets and knows the quality of service provided. Informed the store manager over call about the same.

I visited the place with my friend. We had and beverage abd food everything was delicious, but the washroom wasn't clean; it smelled ther is no tissues its awful. When I went to ask the employee wearing a blue T shirt, he told me they didn't have any tissues. What a blunt way to put it! He was so rude; he doesn't know how to treat customers.
The staff is slow. They made mistakes twice in preparing the order. The worst branch I have visited in my life.

Starbucks on Church Street, Bengaluru, is an exceptional spot that effortlessly combines the charm of a vibrant café with the serene ambiance of a perfect retreat. Located in the heart of one of the city’s most iconic streets, this outlet exudes warmth and sophistication, making it a favorite destination for coffee lovers and social gatherings alike. The moment you step in, you’re greeted by the rich aroma of freshly brewed coffee, instantly uplifting your spirits. The décor is a blend of contemporary elegance and cozy vibes, with two floors of comfortable seating that caters to couples, solo visitors, friends catching up, or even those working remotely. The subtle lighting and soothing music add a touch of tranquility, making it an ideal escape from the bustling city outside. The menu, as always, features Starbucks’ signature range of coffees, teas, and seasonal specials. The staff is courteous, attentive, and ensures a seamless experience, even during busy hours. One of the standout aspects of this outlet is its first floor seating area, it offers a refreshing space to enjoy your coffee while soaking in the vibrant energy of Church Street. Overall, Starbucks Church Street is not just a café but a destination in itself. Whether you're here for a quick caffeine fix, a relaxed evening, or to catch up on work, this Starbucks delivers on all fronts. Highly recommended!

Starbucks offers consistently great coffee with a wide range of drinks and snacks. The ambiance is cozy, perfect for working or meeting friends. Service is generally fast and friendly, though it can get busy during peak hours. A reliable spot for coffee lovers!

Visited this store today at around 8:15am, confirmed with the staff if the outlet is open or closed, after confirming that the store is operational at the given time, waited for about 10 min and the barista forget taking order did not even greet or ask to wait. She continued to do her work as if the customer standing in front did not exist at all. Such a lackadaisical attitude is not expected at Starbucks especially when the customer is a very regular customer at various other outlets and knows the quality of service provided. Informed the store manager over call about the same.

I visited the place with my friend. We had and beverage abd food everything was delicious, but the washroom wasn't clean; it smelled ther is no tissues its awful. When I went to ask the employee wearing a blue T shirt, he told me they didn't have any tissues. What a blunt way to put it! He was so rude; he doesn't know how to treat customers.
The staff is slow. They made mistakes twice in preparing the order. The worst branch I have visited in my life.

Starbucks on Church Street, Bengaluru, is an exceptional spot that effortlessly combines the charm of a vibrant café with the serene ambiance of a perfect retreat. Located in the heart of one of the city’s most iconic streets, this outlet exudes warmth and sophistication, making it a favorite destination for coffee lovers and social gatherings alike. The moment you step in, you’re greeted by the rich aroma of freshly brewed coffee, instantly uplifting your spirits. The décor is a blend of contemporary elegance and cozy vibes, with two floors of comfortable seating that caters to couples, solo visitors, friends catching up, or even those working remotely. The subtle lighting and soothing music add a touch of tranquility, making it an ideal escape from the bustling city outside. The menu, as always, features Starbucks’ signature range of coffees, teas, and seasonal specials. Their handcrafted beverages are consistently delightful, with my personal favorite being the Java chip frupichino, paired perfectly with a warm croissant. The staff is courteous, attentive, and ensures a seamless experience, even during busy hours. One of the standout aspects of this outlet is its first floor seating area, it offers a refreshing space to enjoy your coffee while soaking in the vibrant energy of Church Street. Overall, Starbucks Church Street is not just a café but a destination in itself. Whether you're here for a quick caffeine fix, a relaxed evening, or to catch up on work, this Starbucks delivers on all fronts. Highly recommended!

Excellent place for meetings. Situated at the start of church street and Brigade road. Sitting space at ground and first floor. Availed the 25% off for the first 3 orders.No parking options. You can use the normal church street parking and walk. Metro is also nearby.

Starbucks (Church Street) Spacious outlet with the signature Starbucks calm — good crowd energy. Ideal for long work sessions or relaxed coffee meets. Seating mix of sofas, bar chairs, and outdoor spots. Staff are friendly, remember your regular order if you visit often. Consistent coffee quality, quick Wi-Fi, clean washroom. Peak hours (evenings/weekends) get busy — grab seats early. Nice people-watching spot facing Church Street’s hustle.

The best Starbucks I have ever gone to. I kept ma bag of apparel there and forgot it. I live in Whitefields. so I asked one of Nike’s employee to get there and collect my bag and the Starbucks employee wanted to see me in FaceTime and only when I agreed to giving the bag to the Nike employee. He gave it. This shows how experienced he is and also doesn’t want my bag to go into bad hands. I am so grateful to him. I have posted a picture of him aswell. Thanks Starbucks

Starbucks offers consistently great coffee with a wide range of drinks and snacks. The ambiance is cozy, perfect for working or meeting friends. Service is generally fast and friendly, though it can get busy during peak hours. A reliable spot for coffee lovers!

Visited this store today at around 8:15am, confirmed with the staff if the outlet is open or closed, after confirming that the store is operational at the given time, waited for about 10 min and the barista forget taking order did not even greet or ask to wait. She continued to do her work as if the customer standing in front did not exist at all. Such a lackadaisical attitude is not expected at Starbucks especially when the customer is a very regular customer at various other outlets and knows the quality of service provided. Informed the store manager over call about the same.

I visited the place with my friend. We had and beverage abd food everything was delicious, but the washroom wasn't clean; it smelled ther is no tissues its awful. When I went to ask the employee wearing a blue T shirt, he told me they didn't have any tissues. What a blunt way to put it! He was so rude; he doesn't know how to treat customers.
The staff is slow. They made mistakes twice in preparing the order. The worst branch I have visited in my life.

Starbucks on Church Street, Bengaluru, is an exceptional spot that effortlessly combines the charm of a vibrant café with the serene ambiance of a perfect retreat. Located in the heart of one of the city’s most iconic streets, this outlet exudes warmth and sophistication, making it a favorite destination for coffee lovers and social gatherings alike. The moment you step in, you’re greeted by the rich aroma of freshly brewed coffee, instantly uplifting your spirits. The décor is a blend of contemporary elegance and cozy vibes, with two floors of comfortable seating that caters to couples, solo visitors, friends catching up, or even those working remotely. The subtle lighting and soothing music add a touch of tranquility, making it an ideal escape from the bustling city outside. The menu, as always, features Starbucks’ signature range of coffees, teas, and seasonal specials. Their handcrafted beverages are consistently delightful, with my personal favorite being the Java chip frupichino, paired perfectly with a warm croissant. The staff is courteous, attentive, and ensures a seamless experience, even during busy hours. One of the standout aspects of this outlet is its first floor seating area, it offers a refreshing space to enjoy your coffee while soaking in the vibrant energy of Church Street. Overall, Starbucks Church Street is not just a café but a destination in itself. Whether you're here for a quick caffeine fix, a relaxed evening, or to catch up on work, this Starbucks delivers on all fronts. Highly recommended!

I visited Taj Mumbai today and had lunch at their Shamiana Restaurant with my wife, my sister, and my sister’s 6-month-old son. The experience was absolutely delightful. Right from the entrance, the ambiance felt luxurious and welcoming. The décor is elegant, and the seating arrangement is very comfortable, making it perfect for a relaxed family lunch. The food we ordered was excellent. Every dish reflected authentic flavors and high-quality ingredients. The taste, freshness, and presentation were all top-notch. The food was expensive, of course, but completely worth it for the quality and the overall experience. You can feel the attention to detail in both cooking and plating, which adds to the premium dining experience. What really stood out was the staff. They were exceptionally polite, attentive, and professional – truly the best of the best. They even went out of their way to help with my 6-month-old nephew, so my sister could enjoy her lunch in peace. Their care and warm nature made the meal even more enjoyable and stress-free, especially when dining with a baby. Overall, Shamiana Restaurant at Taj Mumbai is perfect for anyone looking for authentic, high-quality food in a luxurious setting with impeccable service. The combination of delicious cuisine, elegant ambiance, thoughtful staff, and premium quality makes it an unforgettable dining experience. Highly recommended for families, couples, and anyone wanting a premium dining experience in Mumbai.

The Taj Hotel is known for its royal hospitality, rich heritage, and historical significance. Great experience. Different types of drinks and beverages. It's rate is higher than other restaurants, but feeling great. Food, atmosphere , staff members and service are best. The Taj Mahal Palace, is a famous luxury hotel.The hotel is an architectural masterpiece that blends Indian, Islamic, and European styles. Overlooking the Gateway of India and the Arabian Sea, it is one of the most iconic landmarks of Mumbai.

Had the privilege of visiting The Taj Mahal Palace for an interview with Shevaun Haviland, Director General of the British Chambers of Commerce, regarding the UK-India Free Trade Agreement. As always, stepping into the Taj is nothing short of a royal experience — where every corner radiates warmth, grace, and an unmatched sense of hospitality. You don’t just stay here; you’re loved, pampered, and made to feel truly special. Every visit offers a new memory, a new feeling, and a renewed sense of awe. Today’s visit was especially emotional — it happened to be the death anniversary of the legendary Shri Ratan Tata sir. While I was thrilled about the interview, there was also a deep sense of sadness remembering the loss of an invaluable gem the world lost last year on this very day. Forever a Tata fan. The Taj Mahal Palace will always remain a symbol of excellence, heritage, and heart.

I visited Taj Mumbai today and had lunch at their Shamiana Restaurant with my wife, my sister, and my sister’s 6-month-old son. The experience was absolutely delightful. Right from the entrance, the ambiance felt luxurious and welcoming. The décor is elegant, and the seating arrangement is very comfortable, making it perfect for a relaxed family lunch. The food we ordered was excellent. Every dish reflected authentic flavors and high-quality ingredients. The taste, freshness, and presentation were all top-notch. The food was expensive, of course, but completely worth it for the quality and the overall experience. You can feel the attention to detail in both cooking and plating, which adds to the premium dining experience. What really stood out was the staff. They were exceptionally polite, attentive, and professional – truly the best of the best. They even went out of their way to help with my 6-month-old nephew, so my sister could enjoy her lunch in peace. Their care and warm nature made the meal even more enjoyable and stress-free, especially when dining with a baby. Overall, Shamiana Restaurant at Taj Mumbai is perfect for anyone looking for authentic, high-quality food in a luxurious setting with impeccable service. The combination of delicious cuisine, elegant ambiance, thoughtful staff, and premium quality makes it an unforgettable dining experience. Highly recommended for families, couples, and anyone wanting a premium dining experience in Mumbai.

Had the privilege of visiting The Taj Mahal Palace for an interview with Shevaun Haviland, Director General of the British Chambers of Commerce, regarding the UK-India Free Trade Agreement. As always, stepping into the Taj is nothing short of a royal experience — where every corner radiates warmth, grace, and an unmatched sense of hospitality. You don’t just stay here; you’re loved, pampered, and made to feel truly special. Every visit offers a new memory, a new feeling, and a renewed sense of awe. Today’s visit was especially emotional — it happened to be the death anniversary of the legendary Shri Ratan Tata sir. While I was thrilled about the interview, there was also a deep sense of sadness remembering the loss of an invaluable gem the world lost last year on this very day. Forever a Tata fan. The Taj Mahal Palace will always remain a symbol of excellence, heritage, and heart.

The Taj Mahal Palace, is a famous luxury hotel.The hotel is an architectural masterpiece that blends Indian, Islamic, and European styles. Overlooking the Gateway of India and the Arabian Sea, it is one of the most iconic landmarks of Mumbai.

Had the privilege of visiting The Taj Mahal Palace for an interview with Shevaun Haviland, Director General of the British Chambers of Commerce, regarding the UK-India Free Trade Agreement. As always, stepping into the Taj is nothing short of a royal experience — where every corner radiates warmth, grace, and an unmatched sense of hospitality. You don’t just stay here; you’re loved, pampered, and made to feel truly special. Every visit offers a new memory, a new feeling, and a renewed sense of awe. Today’s visit was especially emotional — it happened to be the death anniversary of the legendary Shri Ratan Tata sir. While I was thrilled about the interview, there was also a deep sense of sadness remembering the loss of an invaluable gem the world lost last year on this very day. Forever a Tata fan. The Taj Mahal Palace will always remain a symbol of excellence, heritage, and heart.

I visited Taj Mumbai today and had lunch at their Shamiana Restaurant with my wife, my sister, and my sister’s 6-month-old son. The experience was absolutely delightful. Right from the entrance, the ambiance felt luxurious and welcoming. The décor is elegant, and the seating arrangement is very comfortable, making it perfect for a relaxed family lunch. The food we ordered was excellent. Every dish reflected authentic flavors and high-quality ingredients. The taste, freshness, and presentation were all top-notch. The food was expensive, of course, but completely worth it for the quality and the overall experience. You can feel the attention to detail in both cooking and plating, which adds to the premium dining experience. What really stood out was the staff. They were exceptionally polite, attentive, and professional – truly the best of the best. They even went out of their way to help with my 6-month-old nephew, so my sister could enjoy her lunch in peace. Their care and warm nature made the meal even more enjoyable and stress-free, especially when dining with a baby. Overall, Shamiana Restaurant at Taj Mumbai is perfect for anyone looking for authentic, high-quality food in a luxurious setting with impeccable service. The combination of delicious cuisine, elegant ambiance, thoughtful staff, and premium quality makes it an unforgettable dining experience. Highly recommended for families, couples, and anyone wanting a premium dining experience in Mumbai.

I visited Taj Mumbai today and had lunch at their Shamiana Restaurant with my wife, my sister, and my sister’s 6-month-old son. The experience was absolutely delightful. Right from the entrance, the ambiance felt luxurious and welcoming. The décor is elegant, and the seating arrangement is very comfortable, making it perfect for a relaxed family lunch. The food we ordered was excellent. Every dish reflected authentic flavors and high-quality ingredients. The taste, freshness, and presentation were all top-notch. The food was expensive, of course, but completely worth it for the quality and the overall experience. You can feel the attention to detail in both cooking and plating, which adds to the premium dining experience. What really stood out was the staff. They were exceptionally polite, attentive, and professional – truly the best of the best. They even went out of their way to help with my 6-month-old nephew, so my sister could enjoy her lunch in peace. Their care and warm nature made the meal even more enjoyable and stress-free, especially when dining with a baby. Overall, Shamiana Restaurant at Taj Mumbai is perfect for anyone looking for authentic, high-quality food in a luxurious setting with impeccable service. The combination of delicious cuisine, elegant ambiance, thoughtful staff, and premium quality makes it an unforgettable dining experience. Highly recommended for families, couples, and anyone wanting a premium dining experience in Mumbai.

The Taj Mahal Palace, is a famous luxury hotel.The hotel is an architectural masterpiece that blends Indian, Islamic, and European styles. Had the privilege of visiting The Taj Mahal Palace for an interview with Shevaun Haviland, Director General of the British Chambers of Commerce, regarding the UK-India Free Trade Agreement. As always, stepping into the Taj is nothing short of a royal experience — where every corner radiates warmth, grace, and an unmatched sense of hospitality. You don’t just stay here; you’re loved, pampered, and made to feel truly special. Every visit offers a new memory, a new feeling, and a renewed sense of awe. Today’s visit was especially emotional — it happened to be the death anniversary of the legendary Shri Ratan Tata sir. While I was thrilled about the interview, there was also a deep sense of sadness remembering the loss of an invaluable gem the world lost last year on this very day. Forever a Tata fan. The Taj Mahal Palace will always remain a symbol of excellence, heritage, and heart.

The food we ordered was excellent. Every dish reflected authentic flavors and high-quality ingredients. The taste, freshness, and presentation were all top-notch. The food was expensive, of course, but completely worth it for the quality and the overall experience. You can feel the attention to detail in both cooking and plating, which adds to the premium dining experience. What really stood out was the staff. They were exceptionally polite, attentive, and professional – truly the best of the best. They even went out of their way to help with my 6-month-old nephew, so my sister could enjoy her lunch in peace. Their care and warm nature made the meal even more enjoyable and stress-free, especially when dining with a baby. Overall, Shamiana Restaurant at Taj Mumbai is perfect for anyone looking for authentic, high-quality food in a luxurious setting with impeccable service. The combination of delicious cuisine, elegant ambiance, thoughtful staff, and premium quality makes it an unforgettable dining experience. Highly recommended for families, couples, and anyone wanting a premium dining experience in Mumbai.

The Taj Hotel is known for its royal hospitality, rich heritage, and historical significance. Great experience. Different types of drinks and beverages. It's rate is higher than other restaurants, but feeling great. Food, atmosphere , staff members and service are best. The Taj Mahal Palace, is a famous luxury hotel.The hotel is an architectural masterpiece that blends Indian, Islamic, and European styles. Overlooking the Gateway of India and the Arabian Sea, it is one of the most iconic landmarks of Mumbai.

Had the privilege of visiting The Taj Mahal Palace for an interview with Shevaun Haviland, Director General of the British Chambers of Commerce, regarding the UK-India Free Trade Agreement. As always, stepping into the Taj is nothing short of a royal experience — where every corner radiates warmth, grace, and an unmatched sense of hospitality. You don’t just stay here; you’re loved, pampered, and made to feel truly special. Every visit offers a new memory, a new feeling, and a renewed sense of awe. Today’s visit was especially emotional — it happened to be the death anniversary of the legendary Shri Ratan Tata sir. While I was thrilled about the interview, there was also a deep sense of sadness remembering the loss of an invaluable gem the world lost last year on this very day. Forever a Tata fan. The Taj Mahal Palace will always remain a symbol of excellence, heritage, and heart.

I visited Taj Mumbai today and had lunch at their Shamiana Restaurant with my wife, my sister, and my sister’s 6-month-old son. The experience was absolutely delightful. Right from the entrance, the ambiance felt luxurious and welcoming. The décor is elegant, and the seating arrangement is very comfortable, making it perfect for a relaxed family lunch. The food we ordered was excellent. Every dish reflected authentic flavors and high-quality ingredients. The taste, freshness, and presentation were all top-notch. The food was expensive, of course, but completely worth it for the quality and the overall experience. You can feel the attention to detail in both cooking and plating, which adds to the premium dining experience. What really stood out was the staff. They were exceptionally polite, attentive, and professional – truly the best of the best. They even went out of their way to help with my 6-month-old nephew, so my sister could enjoy her lunch in peace. Their care and warm nature made the meal even more enjoyable and stress-free, especially when dining with a baby. Overall, Shamiana Restaurant at Taj Mumbai is perfect for anyone looking for authentic, high-quality food in a luxurious setting with impeccable service. The combination of delicious cuisine, elegant ambiance, thoughtful staff, and premium quality makes it an unforgettable dining experience. Highly recommended for families, couples, and anyone wanting a premium dining experience in Mumbai.

The Taj Mahal Palace, is a famous luxury hotel.The hotel is an architectural masterpiece that blends Indian, Islamic, and European styles. Overlooking the Gateway of India and the Arabian Sea, it is one of the most iconic landmarks of Mumbai.

Had the privilege of visiting The Taj Mahal Palace for an interview with Shevaun Haviland, Director General of the British Chambers of Commerce, regarding the UK-India Free Trade Agreement. As always, stepping into the Taj is nothing short of a royal experience — where every corner radiates warmth, grace, and an unmatched sense of hospitality. You don’t just stay here; you’re loved, pampered, and made to feel truly special. Every visit offers a new memory, a new feeling, and a renewed sense of awe. Today’s visit was especially emotional — it happened to be the death anniversary of the legendary Shri Ratan Tata sir. While I was thrilled about the interview, there was also a deep sense of sadness remembering the loss of an invaluable gem the world lost last year on this very day. Forever a Tata fan. The Taj Mahal Palace will always remain a symbol of excellence, heritage, and heart.

I visited Taj Mumbai today and had lunch at their Shamiana Restaurant with my wife, my sister, and my sister’s 6-month-old son. The experience was absolutely delightful. Right from the entrance, the ambiance felt luxurious and welcoming. The décor is elegant, and the seating arrangement is very comfortable, making it perfect for a relaxed family lunch. The food we ordered was excellent. Every dish reflected authentic flavors and high-quality ingredients. The taste, freshness, and presentation were all top-notch. The food was expensive, of course, but completely worth it for the quality and the overall experience. You can feel the attention to detail in both cooking and plating, which adds to the premium dining experience. What really stood out was the staff. They were exceptionally polite, attentive, and professional – truly the best of the best. They even went out of their way to help with my 6-month-old nephew, so my sister could enjoy her lunch in peace. Their care and warm nature made the meal even more enjoyable and stress-free, especially when dining with a baby. Overall, Shamiana Restaurant at Taj Mumbai is perfect for anyone looking for authentic, high-quality food in a luxurious setting with impeccable service. The combination of delicious cuisine, elegant ambiance, thoughtful staff, and premium quality makes it an unforgettable dining experience. Highly recommended for families, couples, and anyone wanting a premium dining experience in Mumbai.

The Taj Hotel is known for its royal hospitality, rich heritage, and historical significance. Great experience. Different types of drinks and beverages. It's rate is higher than other restaurants, but feeling great. Food, atmosphere , staff members and service are best. The Taj Mahal Palace, is a famous luxury hotel.The hotel is an architectural masterpiece that blends Indian, Islamic, and European styles. Overlooking the Gateway of India and the Arabian Sea, it is one of the most iconic landmarks of Mumbai.

Had the privilege of visiting The Taj Mahal Palace for an interview with Shevaun Haviland, Director General of the British Chambers of Commerce, regarding the UK-India Free Trade Agreement. As always, stepping into the Taj is nothing short of a royal experience — where every corner radiates warmth, grace, and an unmatched sense of hospitality. You don’t just stay here; you’re loved, pampered, and made to feel truly special. Every visit offers a new memory, a new feeling, and a renewed sense of awe. Today’s visit was especially emotional — it happened to be the death anniversary of the legendary Shri Ratan Tata sir. While I was thrilled about the interview, there was also a deep sense of sadness remembering the loss of an invaluable gem the world lost last year on this very day. Forever a Tata fan. The Taj Mahal Palace will always remain a symbol of excellence, heritage, and heart.
